alert.note: Alert for Central Carbon County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; North Snowy Range Foothills; Shirley Basin; Snowy Range; Upper North Platte River Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 10 at 2:47PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Carbon County through 330 PM MDT... At 247 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Bow River Campground, or 42 miles east of Rawlins, moving north at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Rawlins, Saratoga, Hanna, Sinclair, Medicine Bow, Elk Mountain, Seminoe Campground, Battle Mountain, Shirley Basin, Bow River Campground, Deep Creek Campground, Seminoe Dam, Separation Lake and Arlington. This includes Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 215 and 278. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central Carbon County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; North Snowy Range Foothills; Shirley Basin; Snowy Range; Upper North Platte River Basin
